thread.title: Exxon declares force majeure on exports from Papua LNG project-source

title: Exxon declares force majeure on exports from Papua LNG project-source
text: March 2, 2018 / 5:15 AM / in 31 minutes Exxon declares force majeure on exports from Papua LNG project: source Reuters Staff 1 Min Read TOKYO (Reuters) - Exxon Mobil Corp has declared force majeure on exports from the Papua New Guinea liquefied natural gas (LNG) project, which has been shut since Monday following a powerful earthquake in the remote highlands, an industry source familiar with the matter said on Friday. Exxon had earlier told buyers that the plantâ€™s two LNG trains would be shut for at least seven days FILE PHOTO: The logo for ExxonMobil and PNG LNG, who operate a liquefied natural gas project in Papua New Guinea (PNG), adorns a display at a PNG mining and petroleum investment conference in Sydney, Australia, December 5, 2016. REUTERS/David Gray/File photo Reporting by Osamu Tsukimori; Editing by Christian Schmollinger
